Name: Datum
Description: The standard datum format used. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Name: CoordinateSystem
Description: The standard coordinate system used. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Name: CoordinateZone
Description: The standard coordinate zone being used. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Name: CoordinateSource
Description: The standard coordinate source being used. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Name: ErrorCorrection
Description: The standard method of error correction being used. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Name: Offset
Description: A definition of the standard offset used when taking a coordinate reading on the geo-referenced object.

Name: GeoreferencedObject
Description: The standard object for which the geographic coordinates are being captured. This could be a household, village centroid, etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Name: AddressMatchType
Description: Use for coordinates obtained through address matching only. Identify the address matching method. Example: street segment match, ZIP code centroid, etc. Supports the use of a controlled vocabulary.

Name: CoordinatePairs
Description: Field to capture coordinate pairs as individual pairs or as an array of pairs.

Name: AlternateOffset
Description: If unable to use the standard offset, allows entry of a non-standard offset figure.

Name: AlternateObject
Description: If the default geo-referenced object is unavailable or cannot be measured, allows identification of an alternate object.

Name: AlternateCoordinateSystem
Description: Specifies the coordinate system used for a response if different from that stated in the response structure.

Name: PointFormat
Description: The type attribute is used by the documenter to describe the numeric response domain.

Name: SpatialPrimitive
Description: Indicates the spatial primitive object which the point references.
